page.title: 19WOODLAND AMENITIES,ST.ALLEN.
page.content: {St.Clement Woods}are well-used by Truro people for leisurely walks among mainly coniferous trees on the gently sloping valley-sides of the tiny River Allen & 2 tributary streams.{Forestry {Commission}plans to retain the woods for this purpose &productive woodland. Facilities include{orienteering course used by the Army,youth organisations & Cornwall Orienteering Club;{wayfaring} {course}for families,following the orienteering route non-competitively; {horse-trail,}designed to keep horses away from main footpaths;{nature-trail though repeated vandalism to all information posts has spoilt this.Wild life includes wood- & stream-dwelling birds &insects,especially butterflies. A small area is designated by{Nature {Conservancy Council}as{Site of Special {Scientific Interest}with Royal fern. Also:ancient earthworks,gunpowdermill.
